average_years_schooling_rework.long_name: Average Years of Schooling Among Adults
average_years_schooling_rework.short_description: Average years of schooling among adults age 25 and over.
average_years_schooling_rework.long_description: Average years of schooling among adults age 25 and over. This is calculated by averaging across the education attainment variables (e.g., number of people who indicated their highest level of education is a Bachelor's degree), which are multiplied by the number of years associated with each level of education (e.g., a Bachelor's degree is associate with 16 years; as listed in Bennett, 2011, Table 1).

EduGini.short_description: Education Gini; relative distribution of education attainment.
EduGini.long_description: A measure of the relative distribution of education attainment, ranging from 0 to 1, where 0 means perfectly equal education attainment: \[\mathrm{EduGini_{t}} = (\mu_{t})^{-1}\sum_{i=2}^{n_{t}}\sum_{j=1}^{i-1}p_{t,i}|y_{t,i}-y_{t,j}|p_{t,j}\] Where t is the year, mu is average years of schooling, p is the percentage of the population, y is the number of years associated with each level of attainment, and n is the number of such levels. This is calculated using the years of schooling variable, and the same single education-level variables (as percentages) that go into the average.
EduGini.statement: Education attainment equality in {region_name} is {value} (0 = perfect).
